[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Constant: MAX_PERCENT] [Percentage Overflow] Is MAX_PERCENT=100_00 enforced as an upper bound, or can fee percentages exceed 100% causing math::mul_div() to return values > input? (Medium)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Constant: ONE_SUI] [Minimum Stake Bypass] With ONE_SUI=1_000_000_000, is min_stake properly enforced everywhere, or can micro-stakes below ONE_SUI accumulate dust and break accounting? (Low)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Constant: REWARD_UPDATE_DELAY] [Timestamp Manipulation] REWARD_UPDATE_DELAY is defined but reward update is deprecated - if re-enabled, can timestamp manipulation at epoch boundaries bypass the delay? (Low)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Error: E_PAUSED] [Pause State Race] When paused is set to true at line 547, are there any in-flight transactions that can complete state changes before when_not_paused() checks kick in? (Medium)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Error: E_INCOMPATIBLE_VERSION] [Version Mismatch Window] Does assert_version() at line 619 create a version compatibility window where both VERSION and VERSION-1 pools can interact, causing state corruption? (High)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Init Function] [Initial Fee Configuration] At lines 170-179, fees are hardcoded (base_reward_fee=10%, base_unstake_fee=0.05%) - can these initial values be exploited before migration to new fee system? (Low)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Init Function] [Reward Threshold Exploit] rewards_threshold is initialized to 1.00% at line 175 - if this is too low, can operators update rewards frequently to manipulate ratio? (Medium)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Init Function] [Epoch Zero Accounting] total_staked table is initialized with epoch 0 -> 0 at line 160 - if first stake happens at epoch >0, can this cause incorrect active stake calculations? (Medium)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Init Function] [Double Initialization] Can init() at line 157 be called multiple times to create multiple NativePool objects with shared validator_set references, causing conflicts? (Low)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Struct: NativePool.pending] [Pending Accumulation] If stake_pool() is deprecated, can pending coin at line 127 grow unboundedly as users stake, eventually exceeding validator capacity limits? (High)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Struct: NativePool.collectable_fee] [Fee Overflow] Can collectable_fee at line 128 overflow if fees accumulate over many epochs without collection, causing coin::join() to fail? (Low)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Function: unstake_amount_from_validators()] [Balance Burn] At line 438, total_removed_balance starts from pending - if pending is near 0, can users unstake more than the pool actually holds? (High)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Function: unstake_amount_from_validators()] [Balance Leak] At line 486, excess balance is added back to pending - if this restaking fails silently, is the excess lost forever? (Medium)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Struct: NativePool.total_staked] [Table Growth] Does total_staked table grow unboundedly as new epochs are added, eventually causing storage exhaustion and DoS? (Medium)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Struct: NativePool.staked_update_epoch] [Cursor Desync] Can staked_update_epoch cursor become desynced from actual table entries, causing get_total_staked() to read non-existent epochs? (High)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Function: add_total_staked_unsafe()] [Table Entry Leak] At lines 305-326, new table entries are added but never removed - can this cause unbounded storage growth over time? (Medium)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Function: sub_total_staked_unsafe()] [Missing Entry Handling] At line 353, if staked_update_epoch points to a deleted entry, will table::borrow() abort causing all unstakes to fail? (High)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Event: StakedEvent] [Event-State Desync] If StakedEvent is emitted at line 569 but the actual mint fails, can off-chain systems incorrectly track total staked amounts? (Medium)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Event: UnstakedEvent] [Missing Emission] Are UnstakedEvents properly emitted in all unstake paths, or can some code paths skip emission causing accounting discrepancies? (Low)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Event: RewardsUpdated] [Reward Event Flooding] Can set_rewards_unsafe() or sub_rewards_unsafe() be called frequently to emit excessive RewardsUpdated events, causing indexer DoS? (Low)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Event: StakedUpdated] [Epoch Event Spam] add_total_staked_unsafe() emits two StakedUpdated events at lines 310 and 328 - can this be exploited to flood event logs with misleading data? (Low)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Event: FeeCollectedEvent] [Event Manipulation] Can FeeCollectedEvent at line 534 be emitted with incorrect value if coin::value() and coin::split() amounts differ? (Low)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Invariant: Ratio Integrity] Can get_ratio() return inconsistent values if total_staked is updated by add_total_staked_unsafe() but total_rewards is not updated correspondingly? (High)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Invariant: Fee Accounting] If calculate_reward_fee() rounds down to 0 but sub_rewards_unsafe() still deducts full rewards, can this create a fee accounting gap? (Medium)

[File: liquid_staking/sources/volo_v1/native_pool.move] [Invariant: Ticket Supply] If unstake_ticket::get_total_supply() is not updated atomically with pending balance changes, can get_ratio() become temporarily incorrect? (Medium)
